evidence.source_document: Amended Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: This lawsuit challenges the disruption and attempted destruction, spearheaded by DOGE, of the statutory Federal/State partnership between the NEH and the fifty-six state and jurisdictional humanities. We ask the Court to stop this imminent threat to our Nation's historic and critical support of the humanities by enjoining NEH from fundamentally altering the Federal/State Partnership, antithetical to Congressional intent, and in violation of Congress's instructions in its annual appropriations bills for the agency.

evidence.source_document: Amended Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Defendants' destructive efforts have taken the form of failing to provide notice and an opportunity to be heard prior to and after eliminating grant funding or modifying grants; terminating and partially rescinding grants without statutory authority; terminating grants with no requisite statutory findings by Defendant McDonald; eliminating all but one staff person from the Fed/State office causing work in that office to slow to a crawl; across-the-board delays in the review and approval of otherwise approved grant reimbursements; delays and changes in pending grant applications; widespread terminations of already-issued grants without appeal opportunities; and arbitrary and capricious changes to grant application processes and procedures.
